intro: Rhynchanthus beesianus, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, fragrant white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Rhynchanthus beesianus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
